page.title: 03FARMING WEST OF PENKRIDGE
page.content:
The predominant land cover in this area is rough grazing, but most farms are mixed. There are fields of grain, mainly wheat, some of potatoes and some more intensively managed grassland, though few cattle were to be seen. There were some areas where hay had been cut, but most of the pasture seemed rough grazing land, either enclosed or meadowland alongside the brooks.
Some of the farms were freehold, others were tenant farms of the major land owners, for example Stretton farm, just outside this area.
